Name: LU 135 - Zoning, Special Inwood District Rezoning, Manhattan (C 180204(A) ZMM)
Title: Resolution approving with modifications the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 180204(A) ZMM, a Zoning Map amendment (L.U. No. 135).

History.Action: Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
History.Description: This Resolution was Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Attachments.Name: August 8, 2018 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - August 8, 2018

\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i720\qj WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on June 25, 2018 its decision dated June 25, 2018 (the "Decision"), on the application submitted by the New York City\expndtw-9  Economic Development\expndtw0  Corporation,\expndtw-6  \expndtw0 pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section Nos. 1b, 1d, 3a and 3c, by eliminating from within an existing R7-2 District a C1-3, C1-4 Districts; changing from an R7-2,  C4-4, C8-3, M1-1 Districts to an R7A District; changing from a C8-3 District to an R7D District; changing from an M1-1, M3-1 Districts to an R8 District; changing from an R7-2, M1-1, M3-1 Districts to an R8A District; changing from an M1-1, M3-1 Districts to an R9A District; changing from a C8-3  District to a C4-4A District; changing from an R7-2, C4-4, C8-3 Districts to a C4-4D District; changing from an R7-2, C4-4 Districts to a C4-5D District; changing from an M1-1, M2-1, M3-1 Districts to a C6-2 District; changing from a C8-4 District to a C6-2A District; changing from an M2-1, M3-1 Districts to an M1-4 District; changing from an M3-1 District to an M2-4 District; changing from an M1-1 District to an M1-5, M1-4/R7A, M1-4/R9A Districts; establishing within a proposed R7A, R7D, R8, R8A, R9A Districts a C2-4 District; and establishing a Special Inwood District (IN), which in conjunction with the related actions would facilitate a series of land use actions, including a comprehensive rezoning plan, to advance the goals of the Mayorquote s \i Housing New York: A Five-Borough, Ten-year Plan \i0 and to begin implementation of the Inwood NYC Action Plan, a comprehensive planning effort aimed at supporting growth and vitality by fostering a vibrant mix of uses, public access to the waterfront and the preservation of areas with an existing strong built context in the Inwood neighborhood of Manhattan, Community District 12, (ULURP No. C 180204(A) ZMM), Community District 12,\cf1  \cf0\expndtw-4 Borough of Manhattan \expndtw0 (the "Application");\par
\pard\ltrpar

\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	x720	x1440	x2160	x2880	x3600	x4320	x5040	x5760	x6480	x7200	x7560	x7920	x8640	x8933	ab WHEREAS, the Application is related to applications N\expndtw-4  \expndtw0 180205(A)\expndtw-2  \expndtw0 ZRM (L.U. No. 136), a zoning text  amendment, as modified; C\expndtw-1  \expndtw0 180206\expndtw-2  \expndtw0 PPM (L.U. No. 137), a disposition of City-owned property; C\expndtw-4  \expndtw0 180207\expndtw-2  \expndtw0 PQM (L.U. No. 138), an acquisition of a condominium unit in a future development and of property for public access easements and to rationalize lot boundaries;  C\expndtw-1  \expndtw0 180208\expndtw-2  \expndtw0 HAM (L.U. No. 139), an urban Development Action Area Project (UDAAP)  designation and  project approval and the disposition of City-owned property; and C\expndtw-1  \expndtw0 180073\expndtw-2  \expndtw0 MMM (L.U. No. 140),   a city map amendment to eliminate portions of streets in the Sherman Creek subarea;\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i720\qj WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the City Charter;\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i720\qj WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and Application on July 10, 2018;\par
\par
WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use and environmental implications and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application; and\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj\par
	ab WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the positive declaration (CEQR No. 17DME007M) issued on August 11, 2017 and a Final Environmental Impact Statement (FEIS) for which a Notice of Completion was issued on June 14, 2018 which included an (E) designation to avoid the potential significant adverse impacts related to hazardous materials, air quality and noise (E-459) and the Technical Memoranda dated June 22, 2018 and August 3, 2018 (the \ldblquote Technical Memorandadblquote ).\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	x0	x864	x2016	x3168	x4320	x5472	x6624	x7776	x8928\par
RESOLVED:\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	x0	x720	x864	x2016	x3168	x4320	x5472	x6624	x7776	x8928\par
	ab Having considered the FEIS and the Technical Memoranda, with respect to the Decision and Application, the Council finds that:\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj  	ab\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i720\qj (1)	ab The FEIS meets the requirements of 6 N.Y.C.R.R. Part 617; \par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj	x0	x720	x1080\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar i-720\li1440\qj	x1440 (2)	ab\cf1 Consistent with social, economic and other essential considerations from among the reasonable alternatives available, the action is one which avoids or minimizes adverse environmental impacts to the maximum extent practicable; \par
\par
(3)	ab The adverse environmental impacts identified in the FEIS will be minimized or avoided to the maximum extent practicable by incorporating, as conditions to the approval, those project components related to the environmental and mitigation measures that were identified as practicable; and\par
\par
(4)	ab\cf0 The Decision, together with the FEIS and the Technical Memoranda constitute the written statement of facts, and of social, economic and other factors and standards that form the basis of this determination, pursuant to 6 N.Y.C.R.R. 'a7617.11(d).\par
\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar
owidctlpar\qj\cf0	ab Pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and \par
Application, and based on the environmental determination and consideration described in the report, C 180204(A) ZMM, incorporated by reference herein, the Council approves the Decision of the City Planning Commission with the following modifications:\par
\pard\ltrpar\par
\pard\ltrpar
